name: 羅元隆
objective: This course is designed for students in the civil engineering department. The theme of this course is to encourage students to participate in the discovery of laws and the wonder of nature. The contents of this course include mechanics, dynamics, thermodynamics, electromagnetics, optics, and foundation of modern physics, etc. The lecturers will emphasize or abridge certain contents based on the needs of the civil engineering department. For this course, there will be 3 credits for each of two semesters and 3 lecture hours per week.
schedule:
W01/Temperature and Heat
W02/Thermal Properties of Matter
W03/The First Law of Thermodynamics
W04/The Second Law of Thermodynamics
W05/Electric Charge and Electric Field
W06/Gauss’s Law
W07/Electric Potential
W08/Capacitance and Dielectrics
W09/Mid-term Exam (Written Test)
W10/Current, Resistance, and Electromotive Force
W11/Direct-Current Circuits
W12/Magnetic Field and Magnetic Forces
W13/Sources of Magnetic Field
W14/The Nature and Propagation of Light
W15/Geometric Optics
W16/Interference
W17/Diffraction
W18/Final Exam (Written Test)
scorePolicy:
Attendance 20%
Mid-term Exam 20%
Final Exam 20%
Two Additional Written Tests 40%
materials: University Physics with Modern Physics, Hugh D. Young and Roger A. Freedman, Pearson, 2019, 15th Edition.
